column4: I can't start gedit with 'sudo gedit' or 'gksudo gedit' anymore, the terminal gives some errors about 'Authentication Rejected' and gives me no gedit
if you type "groups" in the terminal do you see "admin" there?
try to restart Xorg, type "sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart"
starting gedit through 'sudo nautilus', but gives nothing back
why do you use nautilus with sudo? try in a terminal "gksu gedit" that work?
I did before (editing files in my apache dir) and it worked fine
never a good idea to use nautilus with sudo. it messes things up.
anyway, 'gksu gedit' gives me: '(gedit:13357): GnomeUI-WARNING **: While connecting to session manager:
which version of ubuntu are you using?
reboot fixed it, I hope it won't crash again :/
if it do fail again, check "gconf-editor" and browse to the apps/gksu and see if "sudo-mode" is active.
